TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HttpFileCollectionBase extends System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public MustInherit Class HttpFileCollectionBase Inherits NameObjectCollectionBase Implements ICollection
public ref class HttpFileCollectionBase abstract : System::Collections::Specialized::NameObjectCollectionBase, System::Collections::ICollection

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for classes that provide access to files that were uploaded by a client.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionBase> class lets you create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario that you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionBase> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollectionWrapper> class to call members of the <xref:System.Web.HttpFileCollection> object.

Docs.param: The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying starts.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at the specified index in the array.
